description: Webinar organized by Ghana chapter to educate others on how to find funders and partners for their activities.
title: How to Find Funders and Partners

description: One-day event in London focused on “Building Digital Governance Together,” exploring key issues like digital cooperation, trust, innovation, and universal digital rights to shape the future of internet governance in the UK
title: UK Internet Governance Forum 2025

description: Delivery of the ISOC PT 2025 Internet Research Prize and panel discussion on the Age Control proposals
title: ISOC PT 2025 Internet Research Prize

description: This webinar will explore how Universal Acceptance forms the foundation for a truly multilingual Internet, the challenges of regional language support, multilingual DNS, inclusion in digital platforms, and the transformative role of technology, design, and policy in shaping linguistic equity online.
title: Universal Acceptance on a Multilingual Internet

description: A critical event designed to challenge how we monitor and maintain underground sewer systems using cutting-edge, autonomous technology.
organizer: ISOC Artificial Intelligence (AI) Special Interest Group
title: AI SIG "Wire-Free Sewer Vision" Hybrid Hackathon

description: Este seminario introduce a Linux como una herramienta útil para el uso cotidiano. Se presentará el trasfondo operativo del sistema, las diferencias entre diversas distribuciones y cómo obtenerlas e instalarlas en distintas plataformas. Incluye demostraciones prácticas del entorno Linux y una sesión interactiva de preguntas y respuestas para aclarar dudas y guiar a quienes deseen comenzar a utilizar este sistema operativo en su vida diaria.
title: LINUX Para Uso Cotidiano

description: An intra-chapter event which showcases our young talent presenting on relevant topics
title: Budding Polymath

description: The Meta-Layer Design Challenge is a global, week-long design challenge exploring how learning, collaboration, and collective intelligence can be supported above the existing Web through a shared civic interface layer - the Meta-Layer. Rather than building new platforms, participants are invited to design concepts, interfaces, and governance models that operate across websites using overlays, shared context, trust signals, and community coordination. The challenge emphasizes human-centered design, interoperability, and public-interest outcomes. The Design Challenge is part of Meta-Layer Week (January 21–28, 2025), co-hosted with Learning Planet. Activities include live sessions, workshops, demonstrations, office hours, and a final showcase. Participants may submit conceptual designs, mockups, diagrams, governance proposals, or lightweight prototypes. No coding is required. Both a Student Track and an Open Track are offered, with shared judging criteria focused on creativity, feasibility, and relevance to collective learning and public-interest infrastructure. The challenge is relevant to Internet governance, digital public infrastructure, education, and community-driven innovation, and aligns with long-standing Internet Society interests in an open, trustworthy, and people-centered Internet.  Audience: Students, educators, designers, technologists, researchers, and community organizers
organizer: ISOC US San Francisco Bay Area Chapter
title: Meta-Layer Design Challenge

description: ISOC Switzerland Chapter’s yearly Public Policy Sessions event will be dedicated in 2026 on the concept of digital sovereignty, launching a long term campaign asking the question “What does digital sovereignty mean?” from the perspective of different actors. As a US-based organization defending digital rights across the world since the 90s, the Internet Society’s European Chapters can play a key role in making sure that the current wave of European claims on digital sovereignty will strengthen digital rights worldwide, while taking into account important challenges related to ecological sustainability, health, and resilience and key values like openness, privacy, and democracy. We are proud to welcome in Zurich 5 special guests with strong expertise on this topic from an academic and/or policy perspective, and active engagement with various civil society organizations, like ISOC Germany and Serbia, FSFE, Wikimedia, La Quadrature du Net. You will have also the chance to meet the growing ISOC Switzerland Chapter and its new home at the center of Zurich, the L200 space, and participate in the discussion!
title: What does Digital Sovereignty means for the Civil Society?
